topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0: Cloud Installation

section.p: Start with this document for complete instructions on how to install your HPE Helion OpenStack cloud, including prerequisites and cloud deployment options.

body.section:
Download the installation packages
Before you get started, learn how the Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 cloud is configured, deployed, and managed in the Installation Overview section.To download the installation packages, perform the following steps:
Launch the Software Updates and Licensing site to download the installation packages:
In a browser, navigate to the Software Updates & Licensing site. You must obtain a Service Agreement ID (SAID) in order to download these files.
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, enter your Service Agreement ID (SAID) in the Software updates and licensing page,
Accept the license agreement and click View available products.
Under Infrastructure Management Software, click Get software updates.
On the product list page, locate the product version and then click Get Softwarecorresponding to it.
Select the required file Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 (Z7550-02110.iso) from the Downloads list and click Download to continue.
The file and its related contents are downloaded.
When you extract the file, you will see the following files and folders dowloaded with it:
Installer Files (Contains Disc Image File (ISO) with MD5 File, and SIG File)
Mandatory Patches Folder ( Contains Patch Files with MD5 File, and SIG File and Readme Text File)
When you download and extract an installer or a patch file from the portal, you will see a MD5 file extracted along with the patch file. For validating the integrity of the downloaded file, you can run the MD5 checksum verification on the downloaded patch file and verify if the fingerprint ( the generated value) of the file matches the version available on the server or the portal.
After the download proces is complete, you now have all the required files to proceed with the cloud installation below:

section.title: Applying the Horizon Bundle
section.p: Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 offers various installation options. You can refer to the installation guides to explore more about the available options that match your requirement. With any selected option, it is still REQUIRED that you apply a specific Horizon Bundle (a tar file used to change the look and feel of the Horizon UI) during installation and configuration of controller-0.
For more information on creating the Horizon Bundle, see the instructions in the hos_theme_v1.1.tgz in the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade SDK tar file.

This component contains instructions and examples for adding a custom bundle to the Horizon GUI. You can modify the existing style sheet, font, and image files to develop your own bundle, and then apply the bundle by installing it, that includes the modified files along with a manifest.
The Horizon Bundle can be applied at various stages. The steps for each stage are described below.
section.note: The recommended method is to install the bundle before running the controller configuration script.

ol.li: Log into the active controller using the CLI.
Delete any previous bundle from the /opt/branding directory.
Copy the new Horizon Bundle hcg4_horizon001_patch001.tgz to the /opt/branding directory.

Install the bundle.
To install the bundle as part of initial system configuration, run the configuration controller script.
If you have already run the controller configuration script, you can install the bundle as follows:
Ensure that any previous bundle is deleted from the /opt/branding directory.
Ensure that the new bundle is copied to the /opt/branding directory.
Execute the following command: sudo service horizon restart
This processes the bundle files on the active controller.
Lock the inactive controller.
Unlock the inactive controller.
